meanings.definition: The state of being tedious or boring.
meanings.sent1: The tedium of waiting in line at the grocery store was unbearable.
meanings.sent2: The lecture was filled with tedium, making it hard to stay awake.
meanings.sent3: The tedium of folding laundry was broken by a sudden dance break.
meanings.sent4: The tedium of the daily commute felt like wading through molasses.
meanings.sent5: The tedium of the meeting was etched in everyone's minds long after it ended.

meanings.definition: A feeling of monotony or dullness.
meanings.sent1: She sighed, feeling the tedium of the rainy day setting in.
meanings.sent2: The tedium of the repetitive task made time seem to slow down.
meanings.sent3: To break the tedium, they decided to have a spontaneous picnic indoors.
meanings.sent4: The tedium of the routine was like a heavy fog hanging over them.
meanings.sent5: The tedium of the long winter days seemed never-ending.

meanings.definition: A tedious or monotonous task or activity.
meanings.sent1: Completing the tedium of data entry felt like watching paint dry.
meanings.sent2: The tedium of scrubbing the floors seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent3: To combat the tedium, they turned the chore into a game.
meanings.sent4: The tedium of assembling the furniture was like solving a giant puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The tedium of the job drained all enthusiasm from him.
